description: MongoDB is a free and open-source document-oriented NoSQL database. Originally developed by 10gen (now MongoDB Inc.), MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas instead of traditional table-based relational database structure. It serves as a FOSS alternative to commercial document databases like Amazon DocumentDB, Azure Cosmos DB, or Oracle NoSQL Database, offering enterprise-grade features including horizontal scaling, replica sets, and sharding without licensing costs, with features like ACID transactions, aggregation pipelines, and full-text search.
name: mongodb
title: MongoDB Installation Guide
